action.action-desc: Mr. Kahele (for himself, Mr. Case, Mr. Kelly of Mississippi, and Mr. Palazzo) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 37, United States Code, to authorize travel and transportation allowances for certain members of the Armed Forces who attend a professional military education institution or training classes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military School Temporary Uprooting Duty Year Act or the Military STUDY Act.

section.header: Travel and transportation allowances for certain members of the Armed Forces who attend a professional military education institution or training classes
section.text: Section 453 of title 37, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Attendance at professional military education institution or training classes

paragraph.text: The Secretary of the military department concerned may authorize temporary duty status, and travel and transportation allowances payable to a member in such status, for a member under the jurisdiction of such Secretary who is reassigned—

subparagraph.text: between duty stations located within the United States;
for a period of not more than one year;
for the purpose of participating in professional military education or training classes; and
with orders to return to the duty station where the member maintains primary residence and the dependents of such member reside.

paragraph.text: If the Secretary of the military department concerned assigns permanent duty status to a member described in paragraph (1), such member shall be eligible for travel and transportation allowances including the following:

subparagraph.text: Transportation, including mileage at the same rate paid for a permanent change of station.
Per diem while traveling between the permanent duty station and professional military education institution or training site.
Per diem paid in the same manner and amount as temporary lodging expenses.
Per diem equal to the amount of the basic allowance for housing under section 403 of this title paid to a member—

clause.text: in the grade of such member;
who resides in the military housing area in which the professional military education institution or training site is located.

subparagraph.text: Movement of household goods in an amount determined under applicable regulations.
